references.name: Serhii Ivanenko
references.reference:
I have had a pleasure of working with Mykola on various projects since September 2017. We have been collaborating in several project teams together. During our cooperation he has always shown strong knowledge and interest in different fields of Software Engineering. His technology bandwidth is being extended thanks to his proactive approach.
Besides immense technical expertise, especially in such areas as Game Development, Mobile, Embedded, and Programming Languages, Mykola also has great self-organization, management, decision-making and problem-solving skills. He always performs all tasks assigned to him in a timely manner and in a good quality, looking for ways how to overcome obstacles on the implementation path.
It's without hesitation that I would continue working with Mykola on our projects in the future. He is a great person to collaborate with on different kinds of projects, including research ones.

references.name: Roman Moravskyi
references.reference:
Our collaboration with Mykola started in September 2017 with the first uni group projects. From the beginning, he showed immense knowledge in various academic disciplines and excellent theoretical and practical skills in computer science and programming.

While working on group projects with a different tech stack and goals, I have noticed Mykola's strong hard, soft and managerial skills. I want to highlight his most outstanding ones:
- Communication skills, excellent English (both written and verbal)
- Project and time management
- Wide variety of tech skills in different proficiencies (Game Development, Web Development, Mobile, Embedded, and more)
- Problem-solving

I would work with Mykola in other roles in the future. He is outstanding to work with because of his reliability and determination, which are key to success.

references.name: Yevheniia Levus
references.reference:
I was a professor teaching Mykola since the beginning of his second semester in February 2018.

Firstly, Mykola completed all of my subjects with excellent grades. He was able to reach to 5% in grades among students in his field of study. I believe he has great potential in learning new information while deepening his expertise in his area of study. He approaches his tasks creatively, often thinking outside the box. Moreover, he sometimes comes up with additional challenges to become more familiar with the subject at matter when solving them.

Secondly, it was noted that Mykola does stand out among other students in personal terms and soft skills. Not only is he adaptable with his problem solving, but he is also communicative, helpful and outgoing. He values teamwork and would often reserve his time to help others, showing both his friendliness towards other students and his leadership skills. He is hard-working, persistent and curious about material, relevant to his field of expertise outside of his work.

references.name: Andrii Fechan
references.reference:
I have known Mykola since the beginning of his fourth semester in February 2019 as a professor teaching him.
I put special care into allowing students to use creative and original solutions to problems during our classes, in which Mykola excelled. He not only showed his personal skill during the studies, but also helped others with more complicated tasks. He also worked with others on research in the field of Electronics and Microcontrollers. His strongest soft skills are communication, teamwork, adaptability, flexibility and problem solving. During team exercises he also showed himself as a great team leader. I think Mykola has potential to become a great researcher and have a successful career.

references.name: Vitalii Yakovyna
references.reference: From 2015 until August 2020 I was Head of Software Dpt. at LPNU and was a professor teaching Mykola Morozov and communicating with him during extracurricular activities. I'd like to note his independent thinking, flexibility and creativity in solving different kinds of non-trivial tasks, his diligence and politeness and his soft-skills in general. He was communicative and helpful both to his peers and to professors. He also has scored highly on students' contests of different kinds. I believe Mykola has prominent potential to become a highly valued researcher and build a successful career path.

education.quote: TUM Graduate School encourages an environment in which academic knowledge and professional qualification are perfectly interwoven.

education.description:
The thesis was written on the topic “An Extensible System for Large Scale Cultural Heritage Data Visualization”. It focuses on providing a flexible, extensible, versatile, and performant architecture for big data processing. The target application for the system is large-scale 3D landscape visualization in a before/after comparison app using interactive storytelling in educational and news coverage context for the destruction in Eastern Ukraine due to the ongoing war.

As part of the research, several scholarly publications were made and presentations at Google Japan, University of Tokyo, Yomiuri Shimbun and others were given.

projects.name: PlanetoidGen
projects.quote: A highly parallel distributed system for pipeline-oriented geographic data processing.
projects.description: The system was developed to use cloud computing to provide near real time generation of large-scale 3D models of eastern Ukraine during the full-scale russian invasion for news coverage and education purposes with a storytelling aspect. The result is similar to a dynamic timeline-based version of Cesium Ion or Google Earth with a small web client using limited pre-generated data and full desktop client displaying landscapes with streamed models. The system uses REST and gRPC for communication through the API, PostgreSQL for temporary map data and metadata storage, MongoDB for 3D model, satellite image, texture, and description storage, Kafka for processing request querying and distribution among multiple worker Software Agents through a load balancer, and Overpass as the cartographic data source. Parallel computing and asynchronous execution is utilized where possible, database information serialization routines are generated through runtime bytecode JIT-compilation, and dynamic SQL stored procedure generation is used for query optimization. The system supports extensions through runtime plugin loading using Dynamic Link Libraries. Kubernetes are used for component container management. Monitoring, reliability, scalability and other aspects are considered. The system can be hosted independently or through AWS/Azure/Google.

projects.name: Crosslight
projects.quote: A language translation / interpretation engine for cross-language compilation / execution.
projects.description: The original idea of the project was to create a modular plugin-based framework for translating code between different programming languages. The goal was to achieve language interoperability in game engines where only a specific scripting language is supported. The project is written in .NET Standard. For now, the development was frozen due to personal time constraints and will be reworked from scratch as part of the cross game engine toolset in the future.

projects.name: Geo Tools
projects.quote: A .NET GeoServer client API with minimal dependencies exclusively on standard libraries.
projects.description: During my master’s thesis project development I wanted to connect GeoServer to a PostgreSQL database during runtime, since the table and schema name wasn’t known beforehand. I found out that there is no official .NET API for the server and the proposed autogenerated OpenAPI project is extremely outdated. Thus, I took it upon myself to write a proper library for GeoServer administration in .NET Standard for anyone to use. Right now the project is temporarily frozen due to lack of personal time, but it will be resumed shortly.

projects.name: Nanoid C++
projects.quote: A tiny, URL-friendly, unique string ID generator for C++, implementation of ai's nanoid.
projects.description: This C++ project was developed for the purpose of providing variable-length unique identifiers for entities in custom game engines and client applications. Can be Safe. It uses mt19937, a strong random generator with a seed from random_device by default, which is not cryptographically secure. However, the library can be expanded using an algorithm of choice (from OpenSSL, Crypto++, Botan, LibCrypto) using the API. Compact. It uses more symbols than UUID (A-Za-z0-9_-) and has the same number of unique options in just 22 symbols instead of 36. Fast. Nanoid is as fast as UUID but can be used in URLs.

projects.name: TUM Info
projects.quote: A bunch of useful exam-related information I've collected while studying at the Technical University of Munich.
projects.description: A relatively big dataset of TUM exam statistics and course reviews. The data is collected anonymously and distributed across schools. The website uses Jekyll, Ruby, and GitHub Actions to statically compile the data and make it available in HTML and JSON formats for further usage or analysis. The project uses a custom Python web scraper to collect courses for a specific student using their login and password.
